channel.title: A question about commands
channel.description: ok it might have been done before but i have no clue how, i am wondering if i can make a command for only 1 rank? like not rank 2+ meaning admins and owners can use. or like ::starter meaning all can use, i want to make commands only for that rank. liek some only mods can use. and stuff liek that.

item.title: A question about commands
item.dc:creator: @Javac_Batch Javac Batch
item.description:
@Javac_Batch wrote:

chassy13:

Use the ‘==’ operator.

It’ll work either way with the int.

Read full topic

item.title: A question about commands
item.dc:creator: @njr99 njr99
item.description:
@njr99 wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights = 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } } }

replace it with that if you want only mods to be able to use it

Read full topic

item.title: A question about commands
item.dc:creator: @Javac_Batch Javac Batch
item.description:
@Javac_Batch wrote:

That’s pretty stupid if you and your administrators can’t spawn. You have to add the “playerRights > 1) {” In the commands then all the moderator commands follow below it, and so on for your administrators.

Read full topic

item.title: A question about commands
item.dc:creator: @k0_gawd_k0 k0 gawd k0
item.description:
@k0_gawd_k0 wrote:

arrg ok i know im not expressing it properly. but ok listen, its hard to explain. ok for instence say i want to add pickup. this is code.

if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && playerRights > 1) {
String[] args = command.split(" ");
if(args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sM(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
sM(“Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100”);
}
}
}

this right here ( && playerRights > 1) { )

that means moderator and admin and owners can use pickup. i only want only moderators to use.
i hope you understand now

Read full topic

item.title: A question about commands
item.dc:creator: @Javac_Batch Javac Batch
item.description:
@Javac_Batch wrote:

To make everyone able to do it change the “= 2” or “= 1” to 0.

0 - All players, 1 - Moderators, 2 - Administrators, 3 - Owner(s)

Read full topic

item.title: A question about commands
item.dc:creator: @k0_gawd_k0 k0 gawd k0
item.description:
@k0_gawd_k0 wrote:

ok i have many commands that u need rank 1. but thats moderator and anything above moderator can use. i dont want that. i want only moderators can use.

Read full topic
